title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Hebrews chapter 1 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Hebrews Chapter 1.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:1, how did God speak to the fathers in time past?
questions.correctAnswer: By the prophets
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:1 states that God spoke to the fathers by the prophets in divers manners.

questions.question: Who has God appointed heir of all things according to Hebrews 1:2?
questions.correctAnswer: His Son
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:2 says God has spoken by His Son, whom He appointed heir of all things.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 1:3 say the Son is the brightness of?
questions.correctAnswer: His glory
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:3 describes the Son as the brightness of God's glory.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 1:4 says the Son is made better than the angels.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:4 states the Son is made so much better than the angels.

questions.question: In Hebrews 1:5, which title did God never say to any angel?
questions.correctAnswer: My Son
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:5 says God never called any angel 'My Son.'

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:6, what are the angels commanded to do when the firstbegotten is brought into the world?
questions.correctAnswer: Worship him
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:6 says all the angels of God must worship the firstbegotten when brought into the world.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 1:7 say angels are made as?
questions.correctAnswer: Ministers and spirits
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:7 says God makes His angels spirits and His ministers a flame of fire.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 1:8 declares that the Son's throne is forever.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:8 states the throne of the Son is forever and ever.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Hebrews 1:9: 'Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: iniquity
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:9 says 'Thou hast loved righteousness, and hated iniquity.'

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:10, what did the Lord lay the foundation of?
questions.correctAnswer: The earth
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:10 says the Lord laid the foundation of the earth.

questions.question: What will happen to the heavens according to Hebrews 1:11?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall perish
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:11 states that the heavens shall perish and wax old as a garment.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 1:12 says the Son will change but His years will not fail.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:12 says the heavens will be changed, but the Son remains the same and His years shall not fail.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:13, who was commanded to sit at God's right hand until enemies are made a footstool?
questions.correctAnswer: The Son
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:13 asks which angel was told to sit at God's right hand, implying it was the Son.

questions.question: What are angels described as in Hebrews 1:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Ministering spirits
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:14 describes angels as ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation.

questions.question: Complete this from Hebrews 1:3: 'When he had by himself purged our sins, he sat down on the right hand of the ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: Majesty on high
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:3 says after purging our sins, He sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high.

medium.title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Hebrews Chapter 1 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt about God's communication. Based on Hebrews 1:1-2, what biblical truth would you share to encourage their faith?
options: God spoke in the past through prophets but now speaks through His Son
God no longer communicates with people today
God only spoke to Moses and no one else
God speaks only through dreams and visions
questions.correctAnswer: God spoke in the past through prophets but now speaks through His Son
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:1-2 teaches that God spoke at various times through the prophets but in these last days has spoken to us by His Son, encouraging trust in God's ongoing revelation.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 1:3 encourage believers to persevere through trials by understanding Jesus’ role?
options: Jesus upholds all things by His powerful word and has purified our sins
Jesus is distant and does not care about our struggles
Jesus only helps the angels, not humans
Jesus' role was limited to teaching only
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus upholds all things by His powerful word and has purified our sins
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:3 explains that Jesus, as the brightness of God's glory, upholds all things and has purified our sins, encouraging believers to trust His sustaining power during hardships.

questions.question: A believer feels insignificant compared to others. Based on Hebrews 1:4, what truth would you share about their worth in Christ?
options: Jesus is made much better than angels and has a superior name
Only angels have an important role before God
Humans are less important than animals
Worth is determined by human achievement
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is made much better than angels and has a superior name
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:4 highlights Jesus’ superiority over angels, reminding believers that their value is found in Him who has a more excellent name, encouraging humility and confidence in their identity.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 1:5 teach about the relationship between God and Jesus that can strengthen our trust in God's promises?
options: God calls Jesus His Son and affirms a father-son relationship
God has no special relationship with Jesus
Jesus is just a prophet like others
questions.correctAnswer: God calls Jesus His Son and affirms a father-son relationship
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:5 quotes God declaring Jesus as His Son, emphasizing a unique relationship that assures believers of God’s faithful promises and authority in Jesus.

questions.question: When sharing the gospel, how does Hebrews 1:6 encourage believers to honor Jesus?
options: All angels are commanded to worship Jesus
Jesus should be ignored in favor of angels
Worship is only for God the Father
questions.correctAnswer: All angels are commanded to worship Jesus
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:6 states that when God introduced the firstborn into the world, He commanded all angels to worship Him, showing Jesus’ divine status and encouraging believers to honor Him.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with understanding spiritual service. According to Hebrews 1:7, what role do angels play in God's work?
options: Angels are ministering spirits and a flame of fire serving God
Angels have no role in spiritual ministry
Angels are created to be worshipped by humans
questions.correctAnswer: Angels are ministering spirits and a flame of fire serving God
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:7 describes angels as spirits and ministers of God’s will, highlighting the importance of spiritual service and encouraging believers to serve faithfully as well.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 1:8 teach about Jesus’ kingship and righteousness that can guide a believer’s integrity at work?
options: Jesus’ throne is forever and His kingdom is ruled by righteousness
Jesus has no authority over earthly matters
Righteousness is optional in the kingdom of God
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus’ throne is forever and His kingdom is ruled by righteousness
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:8 affirms Jesus’ eternal throne and that His sceptre is one of righteousness, encouraging believers to practice honesty and justice in their daily work.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 1:9 teach about Jesus’ attitude towards righteousness and how should believers apply this in family life?
options: Jesus loved righteousness and hated iniquity, showing the importance of moral purity
Righteousness is unimportant in family relationships
Iniquity is to be tolerated for peace
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus loved righteousness and hated iniquity, showing the importance of moral purity
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:9 shows Jesus’ love for righteousness and hatred of sin, encouraging families to pursue holiness and godly character in relationships.

questions.question: A believer is discouraged by the changing world. According to Hebrews 1:10-12, what truth about God’s constancy can encourage contentment?
options: God remains the same while the earth and heavens perish and change
The world is eternal but God changes
Change is a sign of God’s weakness
questions.correctAnswer: God remains the same while the earth and heavens perish and change
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:10-12 contrasts the perishing creation with God’s unchanging nature, encouraging believers to find contentment and trust in God’s eternal stability.

questions.question: How does Hebrews 1:13 encourage believers to persevere through trials by reflecting on Jesus’ exalted position?
options: Jesus sits at God’s right hand until His enemies are made a footstool
Jesus is distant and uninvolved in believers’ struggles
Jesus will not return to judge His enemies
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus sits at God’s right hand until His enemies are made a footstool
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:13 shows Jesus’ exalted position and victorious authority, encouraging believers to persevere in faith knowing He will overcome all opposition.

questions.question: In the context of serving others, what does Hebrews 1:14 teach about angels that can inspire believers in church fellowship?
options: Angels are ministering spirits sent to help those who will inherit salvation
Angels are indifferent to believers’ needs
Angels compete with believers for God’s attention
Angels do not interact with humans
questions.correctAnswer: Angels are ministering spirits sent to help those who will inherit salvation
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:14 reveals angels as servants sent to aid believers, inspiring Christians to participate in supportive fellowship and service within the church.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 1 tells us that Jesus is the exact representation of God's being and sustains all things by His powerful word.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:3 states that Jesus is the brightness of God's glory and the exact representation of His being, sustaining all things by His powerful word, which encourages trust in His power.

questions.question: True or False: According to Hebrews 1, angels have been given a more excellent name than Jesus.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:4 explains that Jesus has inherited a more excellent name than the angels, emphasizing His superiority and encouraging believers to honor Him.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Hebrews 1:9 says, "Thou hast loved _______, and hated iniquity; therefore God, even thy God, hath anointed thee with the oil of gladness above thy fellows."
questions.correctAnswer: righteousness
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:9 emphasizes Jesus’ love for righteousness and hatred for iniquity, highlighting His moral purity as a model for believers.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to doubt God’s care in difficult times. How does Hebrews 1:11-12 help them understand God’s eternal nature?
options: The earth and heavens will perish but God remains unchanged
All things including God will fade away
The earth and heavens are eternal and unchanging
questions.correctAnswer: The earth and heavens will perish but God remains unchanged
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:11-12 contrasts the perishing creation with God’s eternal, unchanging nature, encouraging believers to trust God’s steadfastness amid trials.

hard.title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Hebrews Chapter 1.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:2, by whom has God spoken in these last days?
questions.correctAnswer: By His Son
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:2 states that God has spoken unto us by His Son in these last days, contrasting with the earlier times when He spoke by the prophets.

questions.question: What title is given to the Son in Hebrews 1:2 that signifies His authority over creation?
questions.correctAnswer: Heir of all things
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:2 describes the Son as the one appointed heir of all things, indicating His supreme authority and ownership over creation.

questions.question: Hebrews 1:3 uses the phrase 'brightness of his glory' to describe the Son. What is the significance of this phrase in a Jewish monotheistic context?
options: It signifies the Son as the exact representation of God's nature
It denotes the Son as a created angelic being
It implies the Son is merely a prophet
It points to the Son's human origin
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies the Son as the exact representation of God's nature
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:3 emphasizes that the Son is the express image of God's person, indicating full deity and unity with God’s glory, a concept rooted in Jewish monotheism.

questions.question: What is the theological significance of the Son 'sitting down at the right hand of the Majesty on high' as stated in Hebrews 1:3?
options: It signifies completed work and exalted status
It indicates the Son is a servant awaiting orders
It shows the Son’s temporary position
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies completed work and exalted status
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:3 shows that after purging sins, the Son sat down at God’s right hand, a position of honor and authority, symbolizing the completion of redemptive work.

questions.question: Hebrews 1:4 states the Son is made 'so much better than the angels.' Which reason is given for this superiority?
options: Because He inherited a more excellent name
Because He appeared in the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: Because He inherited a more excellent name
questions.explanation: The verse explains that the Son’s superiority over angels is due to His inheritance of a more excellent name, reflecting His higher rank and unique sonship.

questions.question: Which Old Testament Psalm is alluded to in Hebrews 1:5 when it questions to which angel God said, 'Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee'?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalm 2
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:5 quotes Psalm 2:7, emphasizing the uniqueness of the Son’s divine sonship compared to angels.

questions.question: In Hebrews 1:6, what command is given concerning the 'firstbegotten' Son when He is brought into the world?
options: Let all the angels of God worship him
Let all nations bow before him
questions.correctAnswer: Let all the angels of God worship him
questions.explanation: The verse commands that all angels worship the Son, highlighting His superior status above angelic beings.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:7, what role do angels serve as described in the chapter?
options: Ministering spirits and a flame of fire
questions.correctAnswer: Ministering spirits and a flame of fire
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:7 describes angels as spirits and ministers, using imagery of flame to convey their power and role.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Hebrews 1:8: 'Thy throne, O God, is for ever and ever: a sceptre of _______ is the sceptre of thy kingdom.'
questions.correctAnswer: righteousness
questions.explanation: The verse affirms the Son’s eternal throne and righteous rule, emphasizing his divine kingship.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 1:9 say about the Son's attitude towards righteousness and iniquity?
options: He loved righteousness and hated iniquity
He loved iniquity and hated righteousness
He was unaware of moral distinctions
questions.correctAnswer: He loved righteousness and hated iniquity
questions.explanation: This verse highlights the Son’s moral perfection and divine approval through anointing.

questions.question: Hebrews 1:10 attributes the laying of the earth's foundation to whom?
questions.correctAnswer: The Lord
questions.explanation: The Son is addressed as Lord, who laid the earth’s foundation, affirming His role as Creator.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 1:11 teach about the created heavens and earth compared to the Son?
options: They shall perish but the Son remains
They are eternal like the Son
They are stronger than the Son
questions.correctAnswer: They shall perish but the Son remains
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts the transient nature of creation with the eternal nature of the Son.

questions.question: True or False: Hebrews 1:12 describes the Son as unchanging while creation is subject to decay and change.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:12 states that creation will be changed like a garment, but the Son remains the same with unchanging years.

questions.question: Hebrews 1:13 asks to which angel has God ever said what?
options: Sit on my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool
questions.correctAnswer: Sit on my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool
questions.explanation: This verse highlights the unique exaltation of the Son above all angels.

questions.question: What is the primary role of angels according to Hebrews 1:14?
options: Ministering spirits sent to serve heirs of salvation
questions.correctAnswer: Ministering spirits sent to serve heirs of salvation
questions.explanation: This verse defines angels as servants sent to assist those who will inherit salvation.

theological.title: Hebrews Chapter 1 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Hebrews Chapter 1 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:1-2, how did God communicate to humanity in the past compared to these last days?
options: By the prophets in time past and now by His Son
By the law and now by priests
questions.correctAnswer: By the prophets in time past and now by His Son
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:1-2 states that God spoke in various ways through the prophets formerly, but in these last days He has spoken through His Son. This aligns with Old Testament prophetic revelation (e.g., Amos 3:7) and New Testament fulfillment in Christ (John 1:1-2, 14; Hebrews 1:3).

questions.question: What title is given to the Son in Hebrews 1:2 that signifies His authority over all things?
questions.correctAnswer: Heir of all things
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:2 calls the Son 'heir of all things,' demonstrating His sovereign authority over creation, consistent with Psalm 2:8 and Romans 8:17 which describe Christ's inheritance and kingship.

questions.question: Hebrews 1:3 describes the Son as the 'brightness of his glory' and the 'express image' of God’s person. What does this signify about the nature of Christ?
options: He perfectly reflects God's essence and glory
questions.correctAnswer: He perfectly reflects God's essence and glory
questions.explanation: The phrase 'brightness of his glory' and 'express image' indicate that Christ fully reveals God's nature, as supported by John 14:9 and Colossians 1:15, affirming His deity and unity with the Father.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:3, what act did the Son accomplish before sitting at the right hand of Majesty on high?
questions.correctAnswer: Purged our sins by himself
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:3 emphasizes Christ's atoning work in purging sins alone, pointing to His unique priestly sacrifice, consistent with Isaiah 53:5, 1 John 2:2, and Hebrews 9:12.

questions.question: What superiority of the Son over angels is highlighted in Hebrews 1:4?
options: He inherited a more excellent name
He has wings and a flaming sword
questions.correctAnswer: He inherited a more excellent name
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:4 states that the Son is 'made so much better than the angels' because He has inherited a superior name, reflecting divine status, which contrasts with angels as ministering spirits (Psalm 110:1; Colossians 1:16).

questions.question: Which rhetorical question in Hebrews 1:5 emphasizes that the Son’s relationship with God is unique compared to angels?
options: "Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee?"
"Sit on my right hand until I make thine enemies thy footstool?"
questions.correctAnswer: "Thou art my Son, this day have I begotten thee?"
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:5 uses this question to show that no angel has been called God's Son in this unique filial way, affirming Christ's divine sonship as distinct from created beings (Psalm 2:7; 2 Samuel 7:14).

questions.question: In Hebrews 1:6, what is commanded regarding the 'firstbegotten' Son when He is brought into the world?
options: All the angels of God shall worship him
questions.correctAnswer: All the angels of God shall worship him
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:6 commands angelic worship of the Son, emphasizing His divine status, consistent with Jesus' acceptance of worship in Matthew 2:11 and the worship due only to God (Revelation 5:11-14).

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:7, what role do angels have in relation to God’s will?
options: They are spirits and ministers, often described as flames of fire
They are equal to the Son
questions.correctAnswer: They are spirits and ministers, often described as flames of fire
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:7 describes angels as spirits and ministers sent to serve, matching Old Testament depictions such as Psalm 104:4 and Exodus 3:2, highlighting their created and service role.

questions.question: What eternal kingship attribute is ascribed to the Son in Hebrews 1:8?
options: His throne is forever and ever with a sceptre of righteousness
He will reign for a limited time
questions.correctAnswer: His throne is forever and ever with a sceptre of righteousness
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:8 affirms Christ’s eternal reign and righteous rule, fulfilling Old Testament Messianic prophecy (Psalm 45:6-7; Daniel 7:14) and New Testament teaching on Christ’s eternal kingship.

questions.question: What does Hebrews 1:9 say about the Son’s attitude toward righteousness and iniquity?
options: He loved righteousness and hated iniquity
He neither loved nor hated righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: He loved righteousness and hated iniquity
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:9 highlights the moral perfection of the Son, loving righteousness and hating sin, consistent with God's holiness described in Isaiah 61:8 and 1 John 3:5.

questions.question: According to Hebrews 1:10, what work of creation is attributed to the Son?
options: He laid the foundation of the earth
He made the garden of Eden
questions.correctAnswer: He laid the foundation of the earth
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:10 attributes the creation of the earth and heavens to the Son, affirming His divine role as Creator, in agreement with John 1:3 and Colossians 1:16.

questions.question: What contrast is made between creation and the Son in Hebrews 1:11-12?
options: Creation will perish and wear out, but the Son remains unchanged
Creation is eternal and the Son will pass away
Creation and the Son will both perish
The Son will be folded up like a garment
questions.correctAnswer: Creation will perish and wear out, but the Son remains unchanged
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:11-12 contrasts the temporal nature of creation with the eternal, unchanging nature of the Son, reflecting Psalm 102:25-27 and affirming Christ’s immutability.

questions.question: In Hebrews 1:13, which challenge is posed regarding the angels and the Son?
options: To which angel did God say, 'Sit on my right hand until I make thine enemies thy footstool'?
questions.correctAnswer: To which angel did God say, 'Sit on my right hand until I make thine enemies thy footstool'?
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:13 uses this question to emphasize the Son’s unique exaltation above angels, fulfilling Psalm 110:1 and highlighting Christ’s sovereign authority.

questions.question: What purpose do angels serve according to Hebrews 1:14?
options: They are ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation
questions.correctAnswer: They are ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:14 states angels function as ministering spirits to help believers, consistent with Psalm 34:7 and Luke 1:19, affirming their servant role rather than divine status.

questions.question: What theological truth about Christ’s sonship is emphasized repeatedly in Hebrews 1?
options: His unique divine sonship as distinct from angels
questions.correctAnswer: His unique divine sonship as distinct from angels
questions.explanation: Hebrews 1:5 and 1:6 stress that Christ alone is called God's Son in a unique, begotten sense, setting Him apart from angels, consistent with Psalm 2:7 and John 3:16.
